instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message:
I have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.

Liquid damage around SPI <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>. Burned trace between <RESISTOR>R6110</RESISTOR>/p2 and <RESISTOR>R6120</RESISTOR>/p1 fixed. Burned trace between <RESISTOR>R6102</RESISTOR>/p1 and <CAPACITOR>C6100</CAPACITOR>/p1 fixed. <RESISTOR>R6102</RESISTOR> was replaced.

The fan is spinning but does not make the usual three times cycle. It starts spinning for 6-8 seconds. Then stops. Then starts again and keep spinning forever. On <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> SPI i got 3.3V on pins 1,2,3,8 all the time. Pin 7 is 3.0V all the time. Pins 5,6 only got 3.3V while fan is spinning the first time. After the fan stops and starts again voltage is not coming up on these two pins. 

I then tried flashing a new SPI chip but it did not help. Same issue so I have put the original one back.

<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> = 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> = 3.4V

What now?

Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message: COuld be corrosion under J6100, also check values for all resistors arround <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message:
I removed J6100 from board. All resistors around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> measure correctly according to schematics. 

Still same issue.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message: Did liquid get to the clock chip? Replace it just to be sure.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message: No liquid or signs of it on clock chip. Switched it anyways. Issue persists :-(

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message: Only thing I can think of is another corroded trace from <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> to the CPU or SMC. Remove <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and measure diode mode on all pins.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message:
Diode mode <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> (off the board)

Pin1: 0.497
Pin2: 0.477
Pin3: 2.017 - (should this be so high? <RESISTOR>R6101</RESISTOR> = 3.3KΩ, diode mode pin1 = 0.412)
Pin4: 0.002
Pin5: 0.508
Pin6: 0.508
Pin7: 0.462
Pin8: 0.408

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message: Now remove <RESISTOR>R6114</RESISTOR>-17 and measure again. Only pin 1,2,7,8 are of interest.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message:
OK.

Diode mode. <RESISTOR>R6114</RESISTOR>-17 removed. <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> still off board

Pin1: 0.501
Pin2: 0.480
Pin7: 0.468
Pin8: 0.408

[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen

No problem.

Pin1: 0.501
Pin2: 0.480
Pin5: 0.514
Pin6: 0.514

threads.message:
Hi Duke

Do you have any new advice to this one?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message: Measure diode mode on both side of <RESISTOR>R6114</RESISTOR>-17. Resistors should be removed.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message:
Diode mode with resistors <RESISTOR>R6114</RESISTOR>-17 removed:

<RESISTOR>R6114</RESISTOR>: p1 = 0.735, p2 = 0.484
<RESISTOR>R6115</RESISTOR>: p1 = 0.736, p2 = 0.515
<RESISTOR>R6116</RESISTOR>: p1 = 0.735, p2 = 0.515
<RESISTOR>R6117</RESISTOR>: p1 = 0.735, p2 = 0.505

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message: That all looks ok. Still looking at that 3V on pin 7. It should either be 3.3 or 0, have you checked the pull up resistor and traces are ok?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message: Yes. From the beginning there was no <RESISTOR>R6102</RESISTOR> because it was burned away together with the trace to <CAPACITOR>C6100</CAPACITOR>. So I replaced <RESISTOR>R6102</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C6100</CAPACITOR> and made a trace with battery wire between them. <RESISTOR>R6102</RESISTOR> measures 99.8KΩ and continuity to <CAPACITOR>C6100</CAPACITOR> and <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>/p7,8 is ok. I've got 3.3V on <RESISTOR>R6102</RESISTOR>/pin1 and 3.0V on pin2

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message: I'm out if suggestions then, anywhere else that had corrosion?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message: Nothing obvious. I will inspect carefully. Thanks for your time.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spins, No chime, No image on screen
threads.message: I got this one up and running after a long and lasting fight. It was the BIOS after all. I missed it because I accidentally flashed an A-revision BIOS but it is a B-revision board. But because the A-revision BIOS made same issues as the corrupted original BIOS it trolled me. After flashing correct BIOS for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B and updating ME it is running smoothly. Thanks again for your time and effort Mr Duke. Please mark solved.
